image.altText: A large body of blue water within a reservior

props.synopsis: SA Water — which is owned by the SA government — has been fined for polluting the waterways with grey clay silt when draining the Warren Reservoir, in the Barossa Valley, in May 2023.

title.children: SA Water fined $60k for botched reservoir maintenance that sent sludge into waterways

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding up a phone, with an incoming call from a mysterious hooded figure.

props.synopsis: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

title.children: 'Claim farmers' face fines of up to $50,000 under new SA laws

image.altText: A large truck carrying neatly piled wood logs enters a large yard with thousands of large wooden logs.

props.synopsis: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

title.children: Ambitious plan to convert forestry waste into fuel for ships and planes

image.altText: A man in a suit stands behind a lectern with media microphones on it. To his left is a woman holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: South Australia's Premier says the government is grappling with whether it should give daily updates on the bloom's location during summer, and says it has been "actively engaged" in conversations with the federal government since its emergence.

title.children: SA government grapples with whether it should issue daily bloom updates during summer

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

title.children: Family's anger at seven-year coronial inquest wait

image.altText: An SA police vehicle

props.synopsis: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been charged following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Man to face court over incident involving STAR officers

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is the majority owner of Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

title.children: Singapore's PM is Optus's majority shareholder. Here's why that could be a problem

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: A childcare centre in Adelaide's inner south-west has been ordered to close for two weeks after being handed an emergency action notice following claims children were left unsupervised.

title.children: Childcare centre temporarily shut amid claims children were left unsupervised

image.altText: A UTS building in the background with torn pieces of paper scattered over the top with words from reports written on them

props.synopsis: The National Student Ombudsman is investigating allegations UTS failed to improve its response to sexual harm and gender-based violence despite four reviews since 2022.

title.children: UTS students say they regret reporting sexual harassment as ombudsman investigates

image.altText: Mohammad Shareed Hotak - man with dark hair in green shirt

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has ordered Uber to repay lost wages to a driver it deemed was unfairly deactivated from the rideshare platform.

title.children: Uber ordered to pay lost wages in 'landmark' unfair deactivation case

image.altText: Bright yellow canola flowers in a paddock fill the frame.

props.synopsis: Selfie hunters seeking the perfect social media photo among flowering canola are putting their safety and growers' livelihoods at risk, farmers say.

title.children: Farmers notice more canola crop trespassers wandering into paddocks

image.altText: A Flinders University sign on a glass wall.

props.synopsis: Six internationally recognised marine scientists who are researching South Australia's toxic algal bloom are set to lose their jobs at Flinders University, the ABC understands.

title.children: Flinders University jobs under threat as news of proposed restructure spreads

image.altText: Black and white photo of two people smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian kitchen manufacturer says a scammer has tried to extort money to remove several fake one-star reviews posted to Google.

title.children: SA business asked to pay $US200 to remove fake one-star Google reviews

image.altText: Woman with smallish, white, fluffy dog sitting on her lap as she reclines on the couch

props.synopsis: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

title.children: The phone charger conundrum: Warning about standards in clean tech

image.altText: An illustration shows several people's face and AI is taking jobs

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is coming for our jobs — but will it take them away, or just give us a powerful new assistant?

title.children: 'Waiting for the axe to fall': Fears for jobs in AI boom

image.altText: A red and white sign which reads MS with South Australia & Northern Territory underneath in black letters

props.synopsis: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.

title.children: Non-profit multiple sclerosis support agency in voluntary administration

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: Optus has now told the ABC the firewall upgrade that led to disrupted triple-0 calls was initiated in Chennai, India. Meanwhile veteran stockbroker Marcus Padley says he's "on guard" for a share market wipe-out.

title.children: 'On guard' for market correction, Optus says debacle began in India — as it happened

image.altText: A pregnant woman touching her tummy.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's latest health advice goes against the evidence, stigmatises autism and unfairly blames women.

title.children: Trump's 'tough it out' advice to pregnant women is dangerous

image.altText: Ted Cruz wearing a blue suit speaking at a press conference in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title.children: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

title.children: China's lead over the US in South-East Asia is likely to grow

image.altText: A motorcycle on its side with a crashed car.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 17 people in Taiwan and is expected to head towards the south Chinese coast.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa heads for south China, as 2 million evacuated

image.altText: Neurons

props.synopsis: Clinical trials of a groundbreaking new gene therapy for Huntington's disease have shown that it slows progression of the condition by 75 per cent after three years, researchers say.

title.children: Groundbreaking gene therapy for Huntington's slows progression of disease

image.altText: a punter at the rodeo holding a beer with a stubbie that says 'spurs on condom on'

props.synopsis: Health providers in outback Queensland are taking a light-hearted approach to promoting safe sex, as new data shows sexually transmitted infections are on the rise.

title.children: Rodeo attendees told to 'wrap it like a haybale' as STI rates climb

image.altText: Eggs in an egg carton.

props.synopsis: Eggs are back on supermarket shelves in abundance after shortages caused by bird flu. But do you know what labels like caged and barn-laid mean?

title.children: Do you know what you're buying when choosing between egg labels?

image.altText: A man wearing a bright red jacket, traditional necklaces and a white scarf with blue stripes.

props.synopsis: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt, question his motives.

title.children: Devotees say he's 'chosen by God'. Is this new PM the Trump of the Pacific?

image.altText: Year 11 high school student with long, straight brown hair, and braces.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

title.children: 'Spectacle of disrespect' at Welcome to Country inspires teen essay

image.altText: A man looks at his watch as fluid runs down a tube into his belly.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

title.children: Lives ruined and tears shed from Australians injured by COVID vaccines

image.altText: Jennie and Ray give smile deeply at each other in an open-top car. They are in wedding dress and suit.

props.synopsis: Detectives are this week revisiting the site in WA's outback where the body of prospector Ray Kehlet was found. His wife Jennie is still missing.

title.children: Police on the hunt for missing boots, gloves in fresh cold case search

image.altText: A large patch of land being used for farming, shot from above.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

title.children: Major Australian croc farm irrigating with water high in E. coli

image.altText: An elderly woman with a trolley seen from behind looking at the meat section of a supermarket.

props.synopsis: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

title.children: Rise in grocery thefts 'crazy' but prices unlikely to come down

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel standing on a red carpet looking at the camera and smiling.

props.synopsis: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

title.children: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views, Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'

image.altText: A man wearing a suit scrunches his eyebrows as he looks sideways with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president described Sadiq Khan as "terrible" and warned the British capital was heading towards "sharia law".

title.children: London mayor calls Trump racist, sexist and Islamophobic

image.altText: A man in glasses looks to the right of the camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou says the public would embrace a gay men's player and rejects that the AFL is an unsafe environment.

title.children: Former AFL boss denies league is unsafe for gay men's players

image.altText: A bald man with 'Too good too slow too old go cat 2022 premeriship' tattooed on his head wearing a signed Geelong jersey

props.synopsis: From a unique tattoo to a personalised burger, the AFL grand final is more than just a game for these super fans.

title.children: Geelong's most committed fan hopes to add to premiership tribute
